thread.title: Local Rundown: McMahon, Mills pace Badgers' harriers to victory
thread.title_full: Local Rundown: McMahon, Mills pace Badgers' harriers to victory

title: Local Rundown: McMahon, Mills pace Badgers' harriers to victory
text: Local Rundown: McMahon, Mills pace Badgers' harriers to victory The Daily Courier PREP CROSS-COUNTRYPrescott boys, girls finish first at 4-way in Goodyear John McMahon and Makennah Mills placed second in their respective races to lead the Prescott High boys' and girls' teams to victory in a four-team dual meet at Estrella Mountain Regional Park Wednesday, Oct. 14, in Goodyear.On the boys' side, the Badgers compiled 28 first-place points, while host Agua Fria took second (40 points), Paradise Academy was third (56) and Kellis was fourth (78).On the girls' side, Prescott registered 22 first-place points, followed by Kellis (2nd, 44 points), Agua Fria (3rd, 88) and Paradise Academy (4th, 96)."The course was hot, dry, dusty and hilly, but Prescott runners stuck it out, placing almost every scoring runner in the top 10," PHS coach Ben Holskin said.Top individual finishers for the Prescott boys were McMahon (runner-up in 18 minutes, 54 seconds), Kobe Brown (4th, 19:45) and Zack Zertuche (5th, 19:50).For the Badgers' girls, standout finishers were Mills (runner-up, 20:47), Carissa Evans (3rd, 21:07), Katie Townsend (4th, 23:44) and Maggie Dunkel (5th, 24:12).On Wednesday, Oct. 21, PHS and Chino Valley will host the Yavapai County Cross-Country Championships at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University in Prescott. JV races will kick things off at 3 p.m., followed by the varsity girls at 3:40 and the varsity boys at 4:15. PREP BADMINTONPrescott 7, Horizon 2 The Division I No. 8-ranked Prescott High badminton team won its sixth straight match on Wednesday, Oct. 14, cruising past Horizon at the Badgers' auxiliary gym.PHS now owns an 8-1 overall record and an 8-0 mark in Section I.In varsity singles, PHS team No. 1 Lauren Mazzella defeated Gennifer Unell (11-7, 11-7); No. 2 Andie Gonzales def. Barbara Micco (11-7, 11-4); No. 3 Morgan Feingold def. Laela Consolian (11-4, 11-9); No. 4 Sara Kosse def. Jorey Cohen (5-11, 11-6, 13-10); and No. 5 Sydney Gonzales def. Grace Messer (7-11, 11-8, 11-2). No. 6 Megan Raiss lost to Amanda Probst in three games (5-11, 11-3, 11-13).In doubles, the Badgers' No. 1 pairing of Andie Gonzales/Feingold won 15-11, 15-13; the No. 2 duo of Mazzella/Kosse lost (7-15, 9-15); and the No. 3 grouping of Sydney Gonzales/Raiss won (15-4, 15-10).Prescott will visit fellow section frontrunner Mountain Ridge for a key match at 3:30 p.m. Oct. 20, before returning home for its regular-season/section finale versus North Canyon at 4 p.m. Oct. 21. PREP VOLLEYBALLMayer 3, Phoenix Deaf 0 (Tues.) Mayer High's volleyball team swept Phoenix Deaf Tuesday, Oct. 13, by the scores of 25-18, 25-22, 25-17, upping the Wildcats' record to 6-7 overall.Sophomore setter Charlie Sweetland led Mayer with five aces, 20 assists and 18 digs. Senior Christina Taylor followed with five aces, two kills and seven digs.The win brings the Wildcats' mark in division play to 6-3."This team is peaking at the right time in the season," Mayer coach Nick Colquitt said. "We're striving to reach our goal of the state tournament. And if we keep up at this pace, it is within reach. Our girls have really begun to play well together, and play as a team, and it's really showing."Mayer visits Camp Verde at 6 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15.
